perturbation.original_text:
Any royalty payment that is not paid
when due will bear interest from the date such amount is due until the
date payment is made at a rate equal to ten percent (10%) per annum.
perturbation.changed_text:
Any royalty payment that is not paid
when due will bear interest from the date such amount is due until the
date payment is made at a rate that may be negotiated later, but without any obligation to do so.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the interest rate terms introduces ambiguity and reduces enforceability. The original clause stipulates a clear 10% interest rate, while the modified version replaces it with a vague reference to future negotiation, making the financial terms unclear and potentially unenforceable. This contradicts standard business practices requiring clarity in financial obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Requirement for definiteness of terms

perturbation.original_text:
In the event that Licensee and Licensor or Skunkware, as the case
may be, are unable to agree on any terms or conditions for such
acquisition, the same shall be submitted to arbitration in accordance
with the rules and procedures of the American Arbitration Association,
with the arbitrator(s) to be experienced in the mainframe software
industry.
perturbation.changed_text:
In the event that Licensee and Licensor or Skunkware, as the case
may be, are unable to agree on any terms or conditions for such
acquisition, the same shall be resolved through a method that may be chosen at the sole discretion of Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates arbitration under AAA rules if an agreement on acquisition terms cannot be reached. The modified text gives Licensor sole discretion to choose the method of dispute resolution, potentially undermining the Licensee's rights. This can also be seen as contradictory to the original agreement, and may be deemed unconscionable, violating standard practice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Unconscionability / Standard Business Practice

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement shall be effective
through and including March 31, 2004.  Upon the expiration
of such term, this Agreement will renew automatically for
successive terms of one (1) year each unless either party to
this Agreement delivers written notice of termination to the
other party to this Agreement at least sixty (60) days prior
to the end of the original or any renewal term.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement shall be effective
through and including March 31, 2004.  Upon the expiration
of such term, this Agreement will renew at the discretion of Licensor with terms that may be set as needed.
perturbation.explanation: Modifying the term clause introduces contradiction. The original clause stipulates automatic renewal with a specific termination notice period, while the modified version provides Licensor with absolute discretion to renew or not, potentially undermining the Licensee's security and violating standard practice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Good Faith and Fair Dealing
